content: Fun little game. A bit overly optimistic about how well certain decisions would go, but it's nice to see some optimism.
An excellent game.

A Democratic Socialist what I'm a conservative and I thought it'd be fun to play as the bad guy however I found myself agreeing with a lot of the policies presented kind of interesting I guess I found myself agreeing with a ton of things that could be presented as socialist and I thought it was very interesting I will definitely be playing again

Amazing game!! Hope you guys will develop a game that is situated in Asia. The political scenes among Asian states are controversial, much complicated, and interesting. As an IR student, i very much enjoyed this game :))) thank you!!!!
awesome
Game kept on crashing. Maybe it was my phone's fault
Good game, but sometimes crashes when loading.
Really fun game
Fun game. Shame we're f***** and there's no hope

Very american oriented and sometimes the jargon is slang/playful which sometimes I didn't know what they meant when making decisions but all in all great game. You could probably play it successfully 4 times, but after that it gets boring because you know more than 60% of the scenarios/choices
Amazing. Challenging but not insulting, elegant but to the point, simple but fun, complicated system underneath. Congrats. Please see the aforementioned bug when the app loses focus.
Funny and thought-provoking game, if somewhat left-leaning. Not much replayability beyond one playthrough, though.
Witty and educational!
Does not run on amazon hd10 2019

It was pretty interesting. I love the art and the voter mechanic at the bottom. Ive played a few of these swipe the card style games, and that made this one pretty unique. As for the issues that were covered, there was a lot of variety. A few of them seem sort of outdated/overused, but some were things Ive never heard before. I really appreciate that the game doesnt appear to put being a christian in a bad light as some people like to do, so I thank you for that.
No save function at all!? I left the app for a second to answer a text and lost a term and a half of good work!!!

Having a lot of fun with this game, and it also opened up some good conversations with family and friends about the effect and effectiveness of various policies proposed by currently-active political movements. Really great game!
Hey for some reason the game kicks me out when I tap to start. I dont want a refund and the game looks fun but i would like to play it at some point
interesting thought experiment of a better world
It's fun for the first few playthrough, which might take you about ten minutes, but after that it just feels repetitive. Would give 5 stars if they added more content (but like, a LOT more
Great fun but pretty easy to win.
Fun, but not enough replayability. It gets repetitive quickly
Great gameplay and idea, just too short and easy. Needs some more to it, not just restarting after you complete the objective.

Good start, promising and fun Reins style game but after 5-6 runsI felt I had already exhausted all sensible and possible paths. The timer seems like a hindrance more than a fun gameplay aspect, I eventually stopped reading cards but merely looking at the voter and bar changes to go through more actions.

The game actually deserves 5 starts but gets only 3 because it has a maddening flaw: whenever it loses focus all progress is lost and you must start from the beginning. This is more aggravating because the game is great fun, and very well made
Great game, hope for more content free or paid
I have a pixel 2 and the game won't shut off.. other than that it's pretty funny so far!
Very cute and educational. But lacks replayability, or a good scoring system or leader boards, or level progression.
I've been a fan of Paolo Pedercini's games for years & this one does not disappoint. Solidarity forever!

Cute, easy to learn, Reigns-like about a possible Bernie Sanders presidency. Accurate enough to satisfy Bernie bros (and Bernie sis) but nuanced and open ended enough to entertain all kinds of progressives.
